review_title: "Non-profit" that only cares about making money
pros: Some very kind people to work with and good insurance
cons:
Terrible pay
Extremely sexist company- mostly men in charge taking credit for everything 
All they care about is making money!!! For a "non-profit" company its despicable 
They will use you and pay you as little as possible

pros: The fact that the residents generally do appreciate you being there
cons:
Harassment in the workplace is taken with a grain of salt. Scheduling is very favoritism based, and biased. For a "non-profit organization" the notices they send out, as well as companywide emails, are specifically based on maximizing profits, and asking for managers to work on pushing services or such that will get the most money out of residents. You are told if you try to contact HR with concerns, you will likely lose your job.
When anyone higher-up does visit locations, they eat top notch food, even take large tables from the residents leaving them with a small folding table.
When they visit, the front parking spots are reserved for them only, leaving visitors to walk further to visit their family/friends. 
The nursing staff is hit and miss on being nice/pleasant to the residents, but this is likely caused by the fact that the location is understaffed in every department. The nursing staff is usually staffed UNDER the state minimum for the number of residents residing there.
Simply put, this place is all about "let's see how big of a bonus i can get as upper management" and not about "lets see what we can do to make it a better place for the residents"

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Gibsonia, PA
pros: Competitive pay for CNAs, free parking, pays for you to take the CNA course, provides uniforms, in a convenient location.
cons: Staffing is really bad, there's no way they are making minimum staffing ratios for state. 20 full care residents per CNA in a skilled facility is too much, proper care is impossible sometimes. With 7 years experience, I would still have a panic attack at work at least once a week. Administration and even family members are totally toxic and treat the employees with very little respect. Even aides from staffing agencies have stated they refuse to come back. And you absolutely cannot expect any of the administration to help even though they have nursing degrees.

pros: It was a job position that allowed me to work full time while I was working on my bachelors degree from online with University of Phoenix plus gave me my health benefits. I was also able to working in a team setting with  the staff and work on a one on one basis with the residents.
cons: The con was that I graduated with my degree and a position for office work or clearical came available and not given a chance to get experience

pros: This is an organization that helps senior citizens lead healthy productive lives well into their 80's and 90's.  There are good people working for the company who really care about the residents and the patients.
cons: The CEO is very difficult to work for -- at time abusive, never satisfied, always critical -- without direction, unable to prioritize.  If you are a low to mid-level employee working at St. Barnabas can be a good long-term opportunity.  Working in upper-level management is a dead end.

pros: Flexible with scheduling, easy going work environment.
